properties.areaDesc: Christian, MO; Pulaski, MO; Webster, MO; Ozark, MO; Taney, MO; Douglas, MO; Wright, MO; Laclede, MO; Camden, MO; Texas, MO
properties.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 10 at 6:51PM CST until January 11 at 12:45AM CST by NWS Springfield MO
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a

* Flash Flood Warning for...
Ozark County in southwestern Missouri...
Eastern Webster County in southwestern Missouri...
Douglas County in southwestern Missouri...
Wright County in southwestern Missouri...
Eastern Christian County in southwestern Missouri...
Taney County in southwestern Missouri...
Laclede County in southwestern Missouri...
Pulaski County in central Missouri...
Western Texas County in south central Missouri...
Southeastern Camden County in central Missouri...

* Until 1245 AM CST.

* At 651 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing
heavy rain across the warned area. Up to two inches of rain have
already fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin
shortly.

HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas,
highways, streets and underpasses as well as other
drainage and low lying areas.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Fort Leonard Wood...              Lebanon...
Branson...                        Waynesville...
Mountain Grove...                 Hollister...
St. Robert...                     Ava...
Forsyth...                        Cabool...
Seymour...                        Richland...
Merriam Woods...                  Dixon...
Morgan...                         Mansfield...
Crocker...                        Kissee Mills...
Rockaway Beach...                 Fordland...

This warning includes but is not limited to the following low water
crossings...
Route E north of Highway 38 at The Gasconade River...
Route FF at Hunter Creek east of Ava...
Route FF at Turkey Creek east of Ava...
Route O at Jones Creek just south of Dixon...
and Route H, 3 miles northwest of Stoutland.
properties.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the
dangers of flooding.

A Flash Flood Warning means that flooding is imminent or occurring.
If you are in the warned area move to higher ground immediately.
Residents living along streams and creeks should take immediate
precautions to protect life and property.

CMAMtext: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 12:45 AM CST. Avoid flooded areas.
